intro: Satureja virginiana, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in spikes and are usually pink to purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. The essential oils found in its leaves and flowers contribute to its use in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb.
